comments.author: angela@spinachtiger
comments.content: I like your frosting idea, buffing up whipped cream with cream cheese. As far as cutting out cake, Wilton makes a six inch cake round, which seems to be rage now (to make what is called tiny cakes) enough for four or six. I like that idea a lot. You can then slice each in half and have a tiny four-layer cake. I still want to check out that cookbook though.

comments.author: Renee
comments.content: I know this is an old post but You need the fat in the cream to make whipped cream. Milk has almost all the fat taken out so no you cannot substitute it
